content.description: On a cool but sunny day the  party decided to explore the previously unclimbed slab that lies north of Forgotten Buttress. The slab proved very low angle and only a couple of gradable pitches was found on the line chosen,however the rock and views from the summit are perhaps worth the ramble .Descent. Scramble down the left side (north) of the slab and 4th class to the base of the crag. P1) Forth class about 500' trending left to some slim black dyke's .P2)Up the easy dyke's then left to double anchors below a steeper slab. 180' 5.2 P3)Follow slab passed a bolt at mid height and a #2 friend placement to double anchors. 150' 5.4. P4)Easy slab to summit and fine views. 200'5.2.
content.location: Park at the pull off to Spotted Wolf Canyon , just before the entrance follow the wash north for about 20 mins to the slab ..see photo

climbs.name: Velvet America
climbs.fa: Unknown Canadians, Paul Ross, Jim Madore  - Dec. 6 2008

content.location: Located on the Forgotten Buttress in between Rumble Strips and Hole in One.

content.description: The route starts just left of "Firebird" up a low angled rib.
content.location: This route is located on the Forgotten Buttress, see the route Firebird for detailed approach information.

content.description: More of a mountaineering adventure that involves a bit of slot canyoneering, lots of slab srambling and a final one pitch rock climb to a great summit a natural arch and fine views.From I.70 entrance drive 2.1 miles to pull off on right. The pillars are easily seen . It takes about one and a half hours to scramble the slot canyon and the slabs to reach the arch and the foot of The Pillars.. Enter the obvious slot canyon below left of the Pillars. The narrow part of the slot has a fixed static rope( was found in place), without the rope would be about 5.8.Continue up many slabs trending right to the foot of the Pillars where is found the Golden Arch. P1) Climb the groove passed two protection bolts to a fine summit.One of the highest points on the Reef. 180'5.8. Rap anchors.
content.protection: One #1 Alien ,One#1 Friend, 4 QDs .Two 9mm x200' ropes for rappell.

content.location: This route is located on the Forgotten Buttress, just North of the mouth of Little Spotted Wolf Canyon.  It starts in a little grotto, and is the leftmost route on the wall, two routes left of Rumble Strips.

This route is located on a formation we called the "Forgotten Buttress" as it was previously unclimbed before our ascent.  This buttress is the second buttress to the north of Little Spotted Wolf Canyon.  From the turnoff on the dirt road from I-70, drive south for 2.1 miles to a parking area and campsite on the West side of the road.  From the parking, a good trail leads WSW into the wash.  Walk up the wash a few hundred yards to some old cottonwood trees.  From there, leave the wash and follow an old road/trail towards Little Spotted Wolf Canyon.  Walk up a steep hill and down into the wash on the other side.  From here you can easily see the mouth of Little Spotted Wolf canyon to the west.  Instead of going into the canyon, follow the wash to the north for about 600 feet.  About 30 feet before a small, white boulder in the middle of the wash are some large bushes on the left and a cairn.  From there, follow a cairned trail to the NW and up the major talus tooth just south of Forgotten Buttress.  At the top of the tooth there is a juniper tree and a sloping ledge heading north.  Follow that ledge for about 100 feet, then turn west and scramble up easy 3rd class slabs to the base of the formation.  Total approach time approximately 20 minutes.

content.description: P1) Enter the ramp and follow the center of the slab left of the narrow slot to double anchors, 200'5.5. P2A). Continue up the slab just right of the edge to double anchors 180' 5.6.(From here the FA party tried to continue straight up to join the main slab formation without success, from here the party rapped back down this pitch and climbed the slab right of the narrow slot canyon). P2B). From the anchors go 50' to the right on a good ledge. Climb the shallow groove on the left side of the slab then continue up pleasant slabs to double anchors. Descent. Rap the route or one can 4th class to the right and follow easy grooves to the ground
content.protection: Friends #0.5 to #3. slings . two 60m ropes to rappel
content.location: Starts to the right of the entrance to Little Spotted Wolf Canyon. Climbs the slab /ramp to the right of the canyons retaining wall. The Climb has two second pitches.P1
Located on the Forgotten Buttress to the right of Firebird.

pathTokens: Eastern Reef Area.. AKA The Sandstone Alps
